intro: Ferula undulata, commonly known as the undulating ferula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are deeply lobed and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. Ferula undulata is often found in rocky or arid environments and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
